title: 12. Slaves
description: The legal status, treatment, and roles of slaves in classical Athenian society.

questions.question: In classical Athens, what was the legal status of slaves?
Which actions could a master legally take with a slave?
How were slaves represented in legal disputes?
Under what condition was a slave’s testimony admissible in court?
What option was available to a slave who felt mistreated by their master?
options: Seek refuge at a religious sanctuary

questions.question: What consequence could a master face if found guilty of mistreating a slave?
options: Being forced to sell the slave

questions.question: Which restriction applied to masters’ behaviour toward slaves?
options: They could not engage in pederastic relationships with free boys
They could not use slave labour

questions.question: Which religious right did slaves possess?
options: Participation in civic and family cult practices

questions.question: What economic role did slaves play in Athens?
options: Providing labour in farming, mining, and households

questions.question: Which source suggests slavery itself was rarely questioned in Athens?
According to Xenophon, whom was it considered acceptable to enslave?
Which source notes exceptions to the practice of enslaving only non-Greeks?
Which example shows slaves could work alongside free people?
Which group were state-owned slaves in Athens?
What complaint does the Old Oligarch make about slaves?
What do dramatic sources suggest about relationships between slaves and households?
options: Slaves could have close relationships and raise children
